#Text=Solomon Zeitlin

#Text=Solomon Zeitlin , שְׁלֹמֹה צײטלין , Шломо Цейтлин Shlomo Cejtlin ( Tseitlin , Tseytlin ) ( 28 May 1886 or 31 May 1892 , in Chashniki , Vitebsk Governorate ( now in Vitebsk Region ) in Russia – 28 December 1976 , in the United States ) was a Jewish historian , Talmudic scholar and in his time the world 's leading authority on the Second Commonwealth , also known as the Second Temple period . [ 1 ]
#Text=His work The Rise and Fall of the Judean State is about the Second Temple period .
#Text=Biography
#Text=Russia
#Text=Born in Chasniki , Russia , he attended the Gymnasium and later the Academy of Baron Günzburg .
#Text=There he met and formed a lifelong friendship with Zalman Shazar .
#Text=In 1904 , while in Russia , he obtained Semikhah . [ 2 ]
#Text=Paris and USA
#Text=In Paris
#Text=in 1916 he was awarded a Th . D. from the École Rabbinique and an Élève Titulaire de la Section des Sciences Religeuses from the University of Paris .
#Text=In 1915 he emigrated to America .
#Text=He received his doctorate in 1917 and became professor of Rabbinics . [ 2 ]
#Text=Zeitlin taught at Yeshiva College in New York for two years before going to Dropsie College in Philadelphia , where he served as a Fellow in Rabbinics .
#Text=He edited the academic journal , the Jewish Quarterly Review ( JQR)(1940-1976 ) .
#Text=With A.A. Neuman he co-edited volumes 31 – 57 , and continued as sole editor until his death in 1976 .

#Text=He controversially devoted considerable page-space of the JQR between 1949 and 1964 to engage in scholarly claim and counterclaim over the authenticity and pre-Christian origin of the Dead Sea Scrolls .
#Text=Publishing some two dozen articles on the subject , he remained convinced of their late date . [ 3 ] [ 4 ] [ 5 ]

#Text=In the JQR July 1961 edition he published an article " Jewish Rights in Palestine " by British philosopher and historian Arnold J. Toynbee and his own response " Jewish Rights in Eretz Israel ( Palestine ) " where he rebukes Toynbee for lack of scholarship . [ 6 ]
#Text=In addition to history he taught Talmud , wrote more than 400 articles and books and was instrumental in organizing the American Academy of Jewish Research .
#Text=Private life
#Text=He never married and had no immediate survivors .
#Text=Works
#Text=" An Historical Study of the Canonization of the Hebrew Scripture " , American Academy for Jewish Research , Vol.3 , 1931-1932. [ 7 ]
